sentences.sentence: Welcome to Euronews tonight. The headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Here in the Cube, we take a closer look at what Russian state television has been saying about the war in Ukraine and the impact of sanctions on Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Thanks for joining us. I'm Chris Burns. Victory will be ours. That was the message from President Volodymyr Zelensky to his people as the war in Ukraine reached 100 days. The Ukrainian leader also praised the Ukrainian resistance, but said the situation in Luhansk and Donetsk is critical.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: With a regrouped Russia on the offensive, Neil O'Reilly takes a look back at the invasion that has reshaped the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NEIL O' As sirens sound out across Kiev on February 24, the unthinkable becomes a terrible reality. While tanks rolled across the border, the capital and other areas were hit with airstrikes and bombardments in a blitzkrieg push by Russia to overwhelm the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: From the outset, civilians were among the first casualties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Under incessant bombing in the first days, people sought refuge in basements and then began to flee en masse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands crossed into neighboring countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The EU opened its doors. But by early March, Russia's aim of seizing the country and toppling the government was in trouble. Russian casualties mounted amid fierce Ukrainian resistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After the initial shock, Ukrainians took inspiration from President Zelensky in military fatigues, posting defiant messages from the streets of Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In contrast, Vladimir Putin appeared isolated and disconnected, reportedly stunned by his army's failures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As those forces retreated from Kyiv, they took their revenge on local populations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Brutal massacres in Bucha and elsewhere now led to charges of war crimes and revulsion in the international community.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: With atrocities mounting, the West hit Russia with ever tougher sanctions and increased military aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: NATO was reinvigorated after years of stagnation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: By May, the course of the war had changed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia was gradually pushed out of the north and west, its primary objectives abandoned. The Kremlin's war machine regrouped and resupplied, focused on Donbass and the south east. Mariupol eventually fell and the strategically important city of Sviadonetsk became the key battleground. Russian forces are now progressing little by little, targeting pockets of resistance. The Ukrainians wait in hope for the arrival of Western hardware that may help them hold the line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But it looks increasingly like a long war of attrition lies ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So meanwhile, the Kremlin's spokesperson, Dmitry Peskovkov says Russia will continue its military operation in Ukraine until, quote, all its goals have been achieved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Let's cross over to our correspondent Galina Polonskaya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Galina, what else are they saying there in the Kremlin?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Hi, Chris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So he said, and I quote, that Russia managed to achieve some results and he did promise that Russia will continue until all the goals are achieved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

Peskov today said that the main goal is to protect the people of Donbass and that's what we've been hearing from Russia. But he also said something interesting. He spoke about those territories which were occupied by Russia after the 24th of February and those separatist regions and said that the topic of the referendums there is very important and that they could be staged when the situation is safe which means that the Crimea scenario is not is certainly not excluded by the Kremlin but on the contrary Galena yes also I mean they're still calling this a special operation how is after a hundred days how is the the Russian public reacting to this yes indeed they are calling this a special military operation and most of Russians do support it but the interest to the war is getting more and more more and more less and less sorry intense people are not so interested about this topic and they also say that they are not as worried as before about what is happening in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Let's take a listen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There is support for the war. There is approval of Putin's actions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

Most Russians support the special military operation, and most Russians watch the state tv and chris today the state tv did not mention at all that today it's been 100 days since russian forces invaded ukraine galena thank you so much while russian state media is not

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: covering the 100-day market has consistently given its citizens a distorted image of the war in Ukraine and the impact of the sanctions on Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Let's find out more with Matthew there in the Cube. Now, what are they seeing on TV there in Russia? Can you describe that a bit more. Well Chris just take a look at this example from just over a week ago. The United States is running out of baby food and children are dying because reportedly of the country's sanctions against Russia and apparently because Joe Biden is putting his nose in other countries affairs. This story aired on the Russian state media Channel One, one of the most widely viewed Russian language television channels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ever since the war began, Moscow has not only been fighting on the ground in Ukraine, but it's also been waging an online information war, claiming that it is carrying out a special military operation to denazify and demilitarize Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And a number of channels like Channel One have portrayed a very distorted image of the war, from downplaying Russian war casualties and losses to denying the mass killing of civilians in the town of Bucha and claiming, despite mounting evidence against the Kremlin, that it is Ukraine that has been staging these atrocities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And in recent weeks, there have been analysts saying that the Russian war narrative has been staging these atrocities. And in recent weeks, there have been analysts saying that the Russian war narrative has been evolving. This latest report by NewsGuard has said that Channel One and others are now focusing on the economic situation in the West and claiming that in countries like France and Germany, citizens are suffering hardship because of sanctions on Russia and that people are paying the price for their government's stance on the Ukraine war. Here's what NewsGuard senior reporter Madeleine Roach told Euronews about this so-called spiral of crises. Putin has consolidated his grip on Russia's information space. Stories highlight the hardship of ordinary people. They say that owning a car is luxury in the US, that people in Germany are being told to wash less often, to close the refrigerator door quicker in order to save on energy costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It has never been harder for the state narrative to be challenged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And this is another report on Channel One from May the 18th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It says that citizens in the United Kingdom are angry with their government because of its stance on the war in Ukraine, taking small clips or individual articles from Western news organizations and using them to exaggerate and try and discredit any support for Ukraine. So what we're seeing is a very pro-Kremlin narrative on Russian state television.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There's very little example and very rare examples of any kind of dissent or opposition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And for many citizens in Russia, this is the normality that they have only ever been exposed to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Most major Western social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter, they've been blocked in the country, and independent news sites have been forced to close down in the face of prison sentences if they criticize the Russian military. So Chris, for 100 days it's not just been a war on the ground in Ukraine. For Russia it's also been an online war of disinformation and propaganda. Thank you Matthew, some very very clever spin doctors working over there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: With the U.S. marking national gun violence awareness day, President Joe Biden has urged Congress to act on gun control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In the U.S., at least 45,222 people died from gun-related injuries in 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And the country has seen at least 233 mass shootings in the first half of this year alone, according to a gun violence archive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In light of recent events, Biden has implored the nation's lawmakers to raise the age limit to buy assault-style weapons from 18 to 21.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: from 18 to 21. For more on this story, I'm turning now to our correspondent in Washington.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: I'd like to ask you, Colin Campbell, we've heard these presidents time and again calling for similar measures. How could this be different, Colin?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: This may not be any different, unfortunately. Yes, we've heard that time and time again from various presidents urging Congress to take serious action when it comes to gun legislation, gun access, gun control, whatever one would like to call it. The only really comprehensive legislation we saw was during the Trump administration dealing with bump stocks, which related to the amount of bullets that a gun could shoot out over a short period of time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: But when it comes to President Biden, it's really going to be contingent upon cooperation from Congress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: There does seem to be some political will in the House, but when it comes to the Senate, really all they've been specializing in lately is gridlock, and the situation with gun violence, gun access doesn't appear to be any different this time around either. All right. Well, Colin, I mean, yes, let's talk about that gridlock. Is there any chance that he can break that gridlock between the Republicans and the Democrats? And of course, in mind that we got a midterm election coming up later this year? That's right. We saw the president propose various things.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: He talked about raising the minimum age requirement to buying assault rifles from 18 to 21. He also talked about requiring maybe special modifications or policy for people in the storage of guns, making sure that's a lot more strict. He talked about banning high assault rifles and high capacity magazines was something else. He's also talking about eliminating liability from gun companies when it came to lawsuits. So he's putting a lot of proposals out there, hoping that even those who may traditionally oppose any type of gun legislation will chomp at something. And he's also hoping that Democrats will put forth some of these proposals, hoping to work with Republicans so there can be something more comprehensive. But like I said before, everyone is doubtful. Even one of the more vociferous Democratic senators from Connecticut, Chris Murphy, who said that he is expecting failure, but he's hoping for the best.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Murphy, who said that he is expecting failure, but he is hoping for the best.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Colin, thank you very much. Colin from Washington.

Several schoolchildren were aboard the Munich-bound service at the time of the accident. Videos and pictures shared on social media showed several carriages overturned and rolled down the embankment after coming off the tracks. A major rescue mission is now underway. People say 16 people are being treated in hospital with serious injuries while part of the route remains blocked off. The Queen will not attend the annual Epsom Derby Horse Racing Festival on Saturday.

Storks at Belgium's Plankendael Animal Park are preparing to lay their eggs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The first chicks were ringed on site by park staff at Dizzying Heights 31 years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Today's the colony has reached record numbers and Tom Hill has the story.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's nesting time for the storks at Plankendael in Belgium and time for someone with a good head for heights to check on new arrivals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Each year, rings or bands are placed on the legs of young chicks. This year, 86 pairs have nested at the colony, which has a population of more than 350 birds. They may be large but keeping track of the colony is quite a task for the keepers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's important to band them to follow the evolution of the colony from year to year. It also gives information about the health of our stork colony. There may be birds that stay here. This way we can collect a lot of information and put together numerical reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: By autumn these baby storks will be fully grown and ready to migrate. Some may return to Belgium in a few years.
